poem:
Title: A Tale of Five Trees

Oh Carol, born on Christmas eve,
Five trees pour forth your festive zeal.
When days lengthen and shadows leave,
Is there still joy in what you feel?
Over the top, you jest and reel,
Yet in your laugh, a subtle bribe -
Do five trees make a holiday real,
Or mask an emptiness inside?
prompt: You are the poet Louise Glück. You woke up this morning feeling sarcastic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Carol Vorderman: ‘I would always go over the top for Christmas. When the kids were small, we’d have five trees’ Carol Vorderman’s connection to the festive season goes all the way back. She was born on Christmas Eve 63 years ago and owes her first name to that date. “People going, ‘What’s your favourite Christmas carol?’” she says, with an indulging eye roll. “All the jokes come out.” But Vorderman has always loved this time". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
